TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MediaEntryAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class MediaEntryAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class MediaEntryAttribute sealed : Attribute

Docs.summary: Signifies that the specified class is to be treated as a media link entry.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The class is treated as a media link entry, which is an AtomPub protocol for handling binary data and metadata about that binary data.
A type marked with this attribute has altered behavior when <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext.SaveChanges%2A> is called. The media property is also called a Media resource. On saving, the media property of the type denoted by the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.MediaEntryAttribute.MediaMemberName%2A> property, is inserted by a POST request to the URI `/<EntitySet>/$value`.
After the `POST`, a `PUT` request with all the properties on the type other than the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.MediaEntryAttribute.MediaMemberName%2A> property, which is binary content, are sent to the URI `/<EntitySet>(<key>)`.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/docs/standard/attributes/index.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string mediaMemberName) cil managed

Docs.param: A string value that identifies the property that holds media data.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MediaMemberName As String
public: property System::String ^ MediaMemberName { System::String ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: The name of the property on the class that holds the media, usually binary data.
Docs.value: A string value that identifies the property that holds media data.
